comments.body:
This is tricky.  I'm not sure whether we want flags for each provider (i.e. potentially duplicate kube_master, gce_project, gce_zone -> aws_kube_master, aws_gce_project, aws_gce_zone) or whether we should treat these as "cloud_project" & "cloud_zone".  If the latter, a secondary question is whether we should rename the flags. 

Edit: I don't much care either way.  I'm guessing we'll end up with duplicating (i.e. aws_zone)

You can only have one cloud provider at a time, right?  Perhaps this is a good place for generic cloud patterns, so long as it's not planned to allow a cluster span infrastructure providers...   If that's the case, that's probably an easy small PR instead of adding more to this one.
As long as the concepts fundamentally match up, I'm in favor of generification.
I'm fine with not renaming in this PR, but please file a bug on this.  We just need to figure out the ripple of renaming them.

TODO: remove this ASAP

maybe file a followup issue to do this?
Do we really have to specify an index? can't that be figured out by using a loop variable or something?

I would like to specify an index so that the index of a test stays consistent, even if someone adds a test in the middle of the list.

--brendan

In that case, please add a comment explaining why you want that (what's wrong with name??), and maybe find a better name than "index", because no one is going to assume you want the indexes to get mixed up over time...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +396,400 @@	// Define the tests.  Important: for a clean test grid, please keep ids for a test constant.
	tests := []TestSpec{
		{TestKubernetesROService, "TestKubernetesROService", 1},
		{TestKubeletSendsEvent, "TestKubeletSendsEvent", 2},
		{TestImportantURLs, "TestImportantURLs", 3},

comments.body: Should this be waitForPodComplete() or waitForPodTermination() or something
I do like the idea in a separate pull of `ns.Default` (with ns being the package name)
